153// Internal Assertions and errors
154#if !defined(ELPP_DISABLE_ASSERT)
155# if (defined(ELPP_DEBUG_ASSERT_FAILURE))
156# define ELPP_ASSERT(expr, msg) if (!(expr)) { \
157std::stringstream internalInfoStream; internalInfoStream << msg; \
158ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR \
159<< "EASYLOGGING++ ASSERTION FAILED (LINE: " << __LINE__ << ") [" #expr << "] WITH MESSAGE \"" \
160<< ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_MSG(internalInfoStream.str()) << "\"" << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_ENDL; base::utils::abort(1, \
161"ELPP Assertion failure, please define ELPP_DEBUG_ASSERT_FAILURE"); }
162# else
163# define ELPP_ASSERT(expr, msg) if (!(expr)) { \
164std::stringstream internalInfoStream; internalInfoStream << msg; \
165ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR\
166<< "ASSERTION FAILURE FROM EASYLOGGING++ (LINE: " \
167<< __LINE__ << ") [" #expr << "] WITH MESSAGE \"" << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_MSG(internalInfoStream.str()) << "\"" \
168<< ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_ENDL; }
169# endif // (defined(ELPP_DEBUG_ASSERT_FAILURE))
170#else
171# define ELPP_ASSERT(x, y)
172#endif //(!defined(ELPP_DISABLE_ASSERT)
173#if ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
174# define ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_WRITE_PERROR \
175{ char buff[256]; strerror_s(buff, 256, errno); \
176ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR << ": " << buff << " [" << errno << "]";} (void)0
177#else
178# define ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_WRITE_PERROR \
179ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR << ": " << strerror(errno) << " [" << errno << "]"; (void)0
180#endif // ELPP_COMPILER_MSVC
181#if defined(ELPP_DEBUG_ERRORS)
182# if !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR)
183# define ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR(msg, pe) { \
184std::stringstream internalInfoStream; internalInfoStream << "<ERROR> " << msg; \
185ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR \
186<< "ERROR FROM EASYLOGGING++ (LINE: " << __LINE__ << ") " \
187<< ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_MSG(internalInfoStream.str()) << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_ENDL; \
188if (pe) { ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_ERROR << " "; ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_WRITE_PERROR; }} (void)0
189# endif
190#else
191# undef ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO
192# define ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR(msg, pe)
193#endif // defined(ELPP_DEBUG_ERRORS)
194#if (defined(ELPP_DEBUG_INFO))
195# if !(defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO_LEVEL))
196# define ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO_LEVEL 9
197# endif // !(defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO_LEVEL))
198# if !defined(ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO)
199# define ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(lvl, msg) { if (lvl <= ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO_LEVEL) { \
200std::stringstream internalInfoStream; internalInfoStream << "<INFO> " << msg; \
201ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_OUT_INFO << ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_MSG(internalInfoStream.str()) \
202<< ELPP_INTERNAL_DEBUGGING_ENDL; }}
203# endif
204#else
205# undef ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO
206# define ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(lvl, msg)
207#endif // (defined(ELPP_DEBUG_INFO))

573enum class Level : base::type::EnumType {
575 Global = 1,
577 Trace = 2,
579 Debug = 4,
581 Fatal = 8,
583 Error = 16,
585 Warning = 32,
587 Verbose = 64,
589 Info = 128,
591 Unknown = 1010
592};
593} // namespace el
594namespace std {
595template<> struct hash<el::Level> {
596 public:
597 std::size_t operator()(const el::Level& l) const {
598 return hash<el::base::type::EnumType> {}(static_cast<el::base::type::EnumType>(l));
599 }
600};
601}
602namespace el {
604class LevelHelper : base::StaticClass {
605 public:
607 static const base::type::EnumType kMinValid = static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(Level::Trace);
609 static const base::type::EnumType kMaxValid = static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(Level::Info);
611 static base::type::EnumType castToInt(Level level) {
612 return static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(level);
613 }
615 static Level castFromInt(base::type::EnumType l) {
616 return static_cast<Level>(l);
617 }
620 static const char* convertToString(Level level);

855template <typename T>
856static
857typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<T*>::value, void>::type
858safeDelete(T*& pointer) {
859 if (pointer == nullptr)
860 return;
861 delete pointer;
862 pointer = nullptr;
863}
866namespace bitwise {
867template <typename Enum>
868static inline base::type::EnumType And(Enum e, base::type::EnumType flag) {
869 return static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(flag) & static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(e);
870}
871template <typename Enum>
872static inline base::type::EnumType Not(Enum e, base::type::EnumType flag) {
873 return static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(flag) & ~(static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(e));
874}
875template <typename Enum>
876static inline base::type::EnumType Or(Enum e, base::type::EnumType flag) {
877 return static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(flag) | static_cast<base::type::EnumType>(e);
878}
879} // namespace bitwise
880template <typename Enum>
881static inline void addFlag(Enum e, base::type::EnumType* flag) {
882 *flag = base::utils::bitwise::Or<Enum>(e, *flag);
883}
884template <typename Enum>
885static inline void removeFlag(Enum e, base::type::EnumType* flag) {
886 *flag = base::utils::bitwise::Not<Enum>(e, *flag);
887}
888template <typename Enum>
889static inline bool hasFlag(Enum e, base::type::EnumType flag) {
890 return base::utils::bitwise::And<Enum>(e, flag) > 0x0;
891}
892} // namespace utils
893namespace threading {
894#if ELPP_THREADING_ENABLED
895# if !ELPP_USE_STD_THREADING
896namespace internal {
898class Mutex : base::NoCopy {
899 public:
900 Mutex(void) {
901# if ELPP_OS_UNIX
902 pthread_mutexattr_t attr;
903 pthread_mutexattr_init(&attr);
904 pthread_mutexattr_settype(&attr, PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE);
905 pthread_mutex_init(&m_underlyingMutex, &attr);
906 pthread_mutexattr_destroy(&attr);
907# elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
908 InitializeCriticalSection(&m_underlyingMutex);
909# endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
910 }
911
912 virtual ~Mutex(void) {
913# if ELPP_OS_UNIX
914 pthread_mutex_destroy(&m_underlyingMutex);
915# elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
916 DeleteCriticalSection(&m_underlyingMutex);
917# endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
918 }
919
920 inline void lock(void) {
921# if ELPP_OS_UNIX
922 pthread_mutex_lock(&m_underlyingMutex);
923# elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
924 EnterCriticalSection(&m_underlyingMutex);
925# endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
926 }
927
928 inline bool try_lock(void) {
929# if ELPP_OS_UNIX
930 return (pthread_mutex_trylock(&m_underlyingMutex) == 0);
931# elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
932 return TryEnterCriticalSection(&m_underlyingMutex);
933# endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
934 }
935
936 inline void unlock(void) {
937# if ELPP_OS_UNIX
938 pthread_mutex_unlock(&m_underlyingMutex);
939# elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
940 LeaveCriticalSection(&m_underlyingMutex);
941# endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
942 }
943
944 private:
945# if ELPP_OS_UNIX
946 pthread_mutex_t m_underlyingMutex;
947# elif ELPP_OS_WINDOWS
948 CRITICAL_SECTION m_underlyingMutex;
949# endif // ELPP_OS_UNIX
950};
952template <typename M>
953class ScopedLock : base::NoCopy {
954 public:
955 explicit ScopedLock(M& mutex) {
956 m_mutex = &mutex;
957 m_mutex->lock();
958 }
959
960 virtual ~ScopedLock(void) {
961 m_mutex->unlock();
962 }
963 private:
964 M* m_mutex;
965 ScopedLock(void);
966};
967} // namespace internal
968typedef base::threading::internal::Mutex Mutex;
969typedef base::threading::internal::ScopedLock<base::threading::Mutex> ScopedLock;
970# else
971typedef std::recursive_mutex Mutex;
972typedef std::lock_guard<base::threading::Mutex> ScopedLock;
973# endif // !ELPP_USE_STD_THREADING
974#else
975namespace internal {
977class NoMutex : base::NoCopy {
978 public:
979 NoMutex(void) {}
980 inline void lock(void) {}
981 inline bool try_lock(void) {
982 return true;
983 }
984 inline void unlock(void) {}
985};
987template <typename Mutex>
988class NoScopedLock : base::NoCopy {
989 public:
990 explicit NoScopedLock(Mutex&) {
991 }
992 virtual ~NoScopedLock(void) {
993 }
994 private:
995 NoScopedLock(void);
996};
997} // namespace internal
998typedef base::threading::internal::NoMutex Mutex;
999typedef base::threading::internal::NoScopedLock<base::threading::Mutex> ScopedLock;
1000#endif // ELPP_THREADING_ENABLED
1002class ThreadSafe {
1003 public:

1005 virtual inline void releaseLock(void) ELPP_FINAL { m_mutex.unlock(); }
1006 virtual inline base::threading::Mutex& lock(void) ELPP_FINAL { return m_mutex; }
1007 protected:
1008 ThreadSafe(void) {}
1009 virtual ~ThreadSafe(void) {}
1010 private:
1011 base::threading::Mutex m_mutex;
1012};

1254template <typename T_Ptr, typename Container>
1255class AbstractRegistry : public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
1256 public:
1257 typedef typename Container::iterator iterator;
1258 typedef typename Container::const_iterator const_iterator;
1259
1261 AbstractRegistry(void) {}
1262
1264 AbstractRegistry(AbstractRegistry&& sr) {
1265 if (this == &sr) {
1266 return;
1267 }
1268 unregisterAll();
1269 m_list = std::move(sr.m_list);
1270 }
1271
1272 bool operator==(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, Container>& other) {
1273 if (size() != other.size()) {
1274 return false;
1275 }
1276 for (std::size_t i = 0; i < m_list.size(); ++i) {
1277 if (m_list.at(i) != other.m_list.at(i)) {
1278 return false;
1279 }
1280 }
1281 return true;
1282 }
1283
1284 bool operator!=(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, Container>& other) {
1285 if (size() != other.size()) {
1286 return true;
1287 }
1288 for (std::size_t i = 0; i < m_list.size(); ++i) {
1289 if (m_list.at(i) != other.m_list.at(i)) {
1290 return true;
1291 }
1292 }
1293 return false;
1294 }
1295
1297 AbstractRegistry& operator=(AbstractRegistry&& sr) {
1298 if (this == &sr) {
1299 return *this;
1300 }
1301 unregisterAll();
1302 m_list = std::move(sr.m_list);
1303 return *this;
1304 }
1305
1306 virtual ~AbstractRegistry(void) {
1307 }
1308
1310 virtual inline iterator begin(void) ELPP_FINAL {
1311 return m_list.begin();
1312 }
1313
1315 virtual inline iterator end(void) ELPP_FINAL {
1316 return m_list.end();
1317 }
1318
1319
1321 virtual inline const_iterator cbegin(void) const ELPP_FINAL {
1322 return m_list.cbegin();
1323 }
1324
1326 virtual inline const_iterator cend(void) const ELPP_FINAL {
1327 return m_list.cend();
1328 }
1329
1331 virtual inline bool empty(void) const ELPP_FINAL {
1332 return m_list.empty();
1333 }
1334
1336 virtual inline std::size_t size(void) const ELPP_FINAL {
1337 return m_list.size();
1338 }
1339
1341 virtual inline Container& list(void) ELPP_FINAL {
1342 return m_list;
1343 }
1344
1346 virtual inline const Container& list(void) const ELPP_FINAL {
1347 return m_list;
1348 }
1349
1351 virtual void unregisterAll(void) = 0;
1352
1353 protected:
1354 virtual void deepCopy(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, Container>&) = 0;
1355 void reinitDeepCopy(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, Container>& sr) {
1356 unregisterAll();
1357 deepCopy(sr);
1358 }
1359
1360 private:
1361 Container m_list;
1362};
1363
1369template <typename T_Ptr, typename T_Key = const char*>
1370class Registry : public AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::unordered_map<T_Key, T_Ptr*>> {
1371 public:
1372 typedef typename Registry<T_Ptr, T_Key>::iterator iterator;
1373 typedef typename Registry<T_Ptr, T_Key>::const_iterator const_iterator;
1374
1375 Registry(void) {}
1376
1378 Registry(const Registry& sr) : AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::vector<T_Ptr*>>() {
1379 if (this == &sr) {
1380 return;
1381 }
1382 this->reinitDeepCopy(sr);
1383 }
1384
1388 Registry& operator=(const Registry& sr) {
1389 if (this == &sr) {
1390 return *this;
1391 }
1392 this->reinitDeepCopy(sr);
1393 return *this;
1394 }
1395
1396 virtual ~Registry(void) {
1397 unregisterAll();
1398 }
1399
1400 protected:
1401 virtual void unregisterAll(void) ELPP_FINAL {
1402 if (!this->empty()) {
1403 for (auto&& curr : this->list()) {
1404 base::utils::safeDelete(curr.second);
1405 }
1406 this->list().clear();
1407 }
1408 }
1409
1411 virtual void registerNew(const T_Key& uniqKey, T_Ptr* ptr) ELPP_FINAL {
1412 unregister(uniqKey);
1413 this->list().insert(std::make_pair(uniqKey, ptr));
1414 }
1415
1417 void unregister(const T_Key& uniqKey) {
1418 T_Ptr* existing = get(uniqKey);
1419 if (existing != nullptr) {
1420 this->list().erase(uniqKey);
1421 base::utils::safeDelete(existing);
1422 }
1423 }
1424
1426 T_Ptr* get(const T_Key& uniqKey) {
1427 iterator it = this->list().find(uniqKey);
1428 return it == this->list().end()
1429 ? nullptr
1430 : it->second;
1431 }
1432
1433 private:
1434 virtual void deepCopy(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::unordered_map<T_Key, T_Ptr*>>& sr) ELPP_FINAL {
1435 for (const_iterator it = sr.cbegin(); it != sr.cend(); ++it) {
1436 registerNew(it->first, new T_Ptr(*it->second));
1437 }
1438 }
1439};
1440
1445template <typename T_Ptr, typename Pred>
1446class RegistryWithPred : public AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::vector<T_Ptr*>> {
1447 public:
1448 typedef typename RegistryWithPred<T_Ptr, Pred>::iterator iterator;
1449 typedef typename RegistryWithPred<T_Ptr, Pred>::const_iterator const_iterator;
1450
1451 RegistryWithPred(void) {
1452 }
1453
1454 virtual ~RegistryWithPred(void) {
1455 unregisterAll();
1456 }
1457
1459 RegistryWithPred(const RegistryWithPred& sr) : AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::vector<T_Ptr*>>() {
1460 if (this == &sr) {
1461 return;
1462 }
1463 this->reinitDeepCopy(sr);
1464 }
1465
1469 RegistryWithPred& operator=(const RegistryWithPred& sr) {
1470 if (this == &sr) {
1471 return *this;
1472 }
1473 this->reinitDeepCopy(sr);
1474 return *this;
1475 }
1476
1477 friend base::type::ostream_t& operator<<(base::type::ostream_t& os, const RegistryWithPred& sr) {
1478 for (const_iterator it = sr.list().begin(); it != sr.list().end(); ++it) {
1479 os << ELPP_LITERAL(" ") << **it << ELPP_LITERAL("\n");
1480 }
1481 return os;
1482 }
1483
1484 protected:
1485 virtual void unregisterAll(void) ELPP_FINAL {
1486 if (!this->empty()) {
1487 for (auto&& curr : this->list()) {
1488 base::utils::safeDelete(curr);
1489 }
1490 this->list().clear();
1491 }
1492 }
1493
1494 virtual void unregister(T_Ptr*& ptr) ELPP_FINAL {
1495 if (ptr) {
1496 iterator iter = this->begin();
1497 for (; iter != this->end(); ++iter) {
1498 if (ptr == *iter) {
1499 break;
1500 }
1501 }
1502 if (iter != this->end() && *iter != nullptr) {
1503 this->list().erase(iter);
1504 base::utils::safeDelete(*iter);
1505 }
1506 }
1507 }
1508
1509 virtual inline void registerNew(T_Ptr* ptr) ELPP_FINAL {
1510 this->list().push_back(ptr);
1511 }
1512
1515 template <typename T, typename T2>
1516 T_Ptr* get(const T& arg1, const T2 arg2) {
1517 iterator iter = std::find_if(this->list().begin(), this->list().end(), Pred(arg1, arg2));
1518 if (iter != this->list().end() && *iter != nullptr) {
1519 return *iter;
1520 }
1521 return nullptr;
1522 }
1523
1524 private:
1525 virtual void deepCopy(const AbstractRegistry<T_Ptr, std::vector<T_Ptr*>>& sr) {
1526 for (const_iterator it = sr.list().begin(); it != sr.list().end(); ++it) {
1527 registerNew(new T_Ptr(**it));
1528 }
1529 }
1530};
1531class Utils {
1532 public:
1533 template <typename T, typename TPtr>
1534 static bool installCallback(const std::string& id, std::unordered_map<std::string, TPtr>* mapT) {
1535 if (mapT->find(id) == mapT->end()) {
1536 mapT->insert(std::make_pair(id, TPtr(new T())));
1537 return true;
1538 }
1539 return false;
1540 }
1541
1542 template <typename T, typename TPtr>
1543 static void uninstallCallback(const std::string& id, std::unordered_map<std::string, TPtr>* mapT) {
1544 if (mapT->find(id) != mapT->end()) {
1545 mapT->erase(id);
1546 }
1547 }
1548
1549 template <typename T, typename TPtr>
1550 static T* callback(const std::string& id, std::unordered_map<std::string, TPtr>* mapT) {
1551 typename std::unordered_map<std::string, TPtr>::iterator iter = mapT->find(id);
1552 if (iter != mapT->end()) {
1553 return static_cast<T*>(iter->second.get());
1554 }
1555 return nullptr;
1556 }
1557};
1558} // namespace utils
1559} // namespace base

1952 template <typename Conf_T>
1953 inline Conf_T getConfigByVal(Level level, const std::unordered_map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
1954 base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
1955 return unsafeGetConfigByVal(level, confMap, confName); // This is not unsafe anymore - mutex locked in scope
1956 }
1957
1958 template <typename Conf_T>
1959 inline Conf_T& getConfigByRef(Level level, std::unordered_map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
1960 base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
1961 return unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, confMap, confName); // This is not unsafe anymore - mutex locked in scope
1962 }
1963
1964 template <typename Conf_T>
1965 Conf_T unsafeGetConfigByVal(Level level, const std::unordered_map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
1966 ELPP_UNUSED(confName);
1967 typename std::unordered_map<Level, Conf_T>::const_iterator it = confMap->find(level);
1968 if (it == confMap->end()) {
1969 try {
1970 return confMap->at(Level::Global);
1971 } catch (...) {
1972 ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unable to get configuration [" << confName << "] for level ["
1973 << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "]"
1974 << std::endl << "Please ensure you have properly configured logger.", false);
1975 return Conf_T();
1976 }
1977 }
1978 return it->second;
1979 }
1980
1981 template <typename Conf_T>
1982 Conf_T& unsafeGetConfigByRef(Level level, std::unordered_map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
1983 ELPP_UNUSED(confName);
1984 typename std::unordered_map<Level, Conf_T>::iterator it = confMap->find(level);
1985 if (it == confMap->end()) {
1986 try {
1987 return confMap->at(Level::Global);
1988 } catch (...) {
1989 ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unable to get configuration [" << confName << "] for level ["
1990 << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "]"
1991 << std::endl << "Please ensure you have properly configured logger.", false);
1992 }
1993 }
1994 return it->second;
1995 }
1996
1997 template <typename Conf_T>
1998 void setValue(Level level, const Conf_T& value, std::unordered_map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap,
1999 bool includeGlobalLevel = true) {
2000 // If map is empty and we are allowed to add into generic level (Level::Global), do it!
2001 if (confMap->empty() && includeGlobalLevel) {
2002 confMap->insert(std::make_pair(Level::Global, value));
2003 return;
2004 }
2005 // If same value exist in generic level already, dont add it to explicit level
2006 typename std::unordered_map<Level, Conf_T>::iterator it = confMap->find(Level::Global);
2007 if (it != confMap->end() && it->second == value) {
2008 return;
2009 }
2010 // Now make sure we dont double up values if we really need to add it to explicit level
2011 it = confMap->find(level);
2012 if (it == confMap->end()) {
2013 // Value not found for level, add new
2014 confMap->insert(std::make_pair(level, value));
2015 } else {
2016 // Value found, just update value
2017 confMap->at(level) = value;
2018 }
2019 }

2520 AsyncLogItem result = m_queue.front();
2521 m_queue.pop();
2522 return result;
2523 }

2677 inline void setThreadName(const std::string& name) {
2678 if (name.empty()) return;
2679 base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(m_threadNamesLock);
2680 m_threadNames[base::threading::getCurrentThreadId()] = name;
2681 }
2682
2683 inline std::string getThreadName(const std::string& threadId) {
2684 base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(m_threadNamesLock);
2685 std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string>::const_iterator it = m_threadNames.find(threadId);
2686 if (it == m_threadNames.end()) {
2687 return threadId;
2688 }
2689 return it->second;
2690 }

2792namespace workarounds {
2794template <typename T, typename Container>
2795class IterableContainer {
2796 public:
2797 typedef typename Container::iterator iterator;
2798 typedef typename Container::const_iterator const_iterator;
2799 IterableContainer(void) {}
2800 virtual ~IterableContainer(void) {}
2801 iterator begin(void) {
2802 return getContainer().begin();
2803 }
2804 iterator end(void) {
2805 return getContainer().end();
2806 }
2807 private:
2808 virtual Container& getContainer(void) = 0;
2809};
2811template<typename T, typename Container = std::vector<T>, typename Comparator = std::less<typename Container::value_type>>
2812class IterablePriorityQueue : public IterableContainer<T, Container>,
2813 public std::priority_queue<T, Container, Comparator> {
2814 public:
2815 IterablePriorityQueue(std::priority_queue<T, Container, Comparator> queue_) {
2816 std::size_t count_ = 0;
2817 while (++count_ < base::consts::kMaxLogPerContainer && !queue_.empty()) {
2818 this->push(queue_.top());
2819 queue_.pop();
2820 }
2821 }
2822 private:
2823 inline Container& getContainer(void) {
2824 return this->c;
2825 }
2826};
2828template<typename T, typename Container = std::deque<T>>
2829class IterableQueue : public IterableContainer<T, Container>, public std::queue<T, Container> {
2830 public:
2831 IterableQueue(std::queue<T, Container> queue_) {
2832 std::size_t count_ = 0;
2833 while (++count_ < base::consts::kMaxLogPerContainer && !queue_.empty()) {
2834 this->push(queue_.front());
2835 queue_.pop();
2836 }
2837 }
2838 private:
2839 inline Container& getContainer(void) {
2840 return this->c;
2841 }
2842};
2844template<typename T, typename Container = std::deque<T>>
2845class IterableStack : public IterableContainer<T, Container>, public std::stack<T, Container> {
2846 public:
2847 IterableStack(std::stack<T, Container> stack_) {
2848 std::size_t count_ = 0;
2849 while (++count_ < base::consts::kMaxLogPerContainer && !stack_.empty()) {
2850 this->push(stack_.top());
2851 stack_.pop();
2852 }
2853 }
2854 private:
2855 inline Container& getContainer(void) {
2856 return this->c;
2857 }
2858};
2859} // namespace workarounds
2860#endif // defined(ELPP_STL_LOGGING)
2861// Log message builder
2862class MessageBuilder {
2863 public:
2864 MessageBuilder(void) : m_logger(nullptr), m_containerLogSeparator(ELPP_LITERAL("")) {}
2865 void initialize(Logger* logger);
2866
2867# define ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(LOG_TYPE)\
2868MessageBuilder& operator<<(LOG_TYPE msg) {\
2869m_logger->stream() << msg;\
2870if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::AutoSpacing)) {\
2871m_logger->stream() << " ";\
2872}\
2873return *this;\
2874}
2875
2876 inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const std::string& msg) {
2877 return operator<<(msg.c_str());
2878 }
2879 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(char)
2880 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(bool)
2881 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(signed short)
2882 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(unsigned short)
2883 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(signed int)
2884 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(unsigned int)
2885 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(signed long)
2886 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(unsigned long)
2887 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(float)
2888 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(double)
2889 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(char*)
2890 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(const char*)
2891 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(const void*)
2892 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(long double)
2893 inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const std::wstring& msg) {
2894 return operator<<(msg.c_str());
2895 }
2896 MessageBuilder& operator<<(const wchar_t* msg);
2897 // ostream manipulators
2898 inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(std::ostream& (*OStreamMani)(std::ostream&)) {
2899 m_logger->stream() << OStreamMani;
2900 return *this;
2901 }
2902#define ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_ONE_ARG(temp) \
2903template <typename T> \
2904inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const temp<T>& template_inst) { \
2905return writeIterator(template_inst.begin(), template_inst.end(), template_inst.size()); \
2906}
2907#define ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_TWO_ARG(temp) \
2908template <typename T1, typename T2> \
2909inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const temp<T1, T2>& template_inst) { \
2910return writeIterator(template_inst.begin(), template_inst.end(), template_inst.size()); \
2911}
2912#define ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_THREE_ARG(temp) \
2913template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T3> \
2914inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const temp<T1, T2, T3>& template_inst) { \
2915return writeIterator(template_inst.begin(), template_inst.end(), template_inst.size()); \
2916}
2917#define ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_FOUR_ARG(temp) \
2918template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T3, typename T4> \
2919inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const temp<T1, T2, T3, T4>& template_inst) { \
2920return writeIterator(template_inst.begin(), template_inst.end(), template_inst.size()); \
2921}
2922#define ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_FIVE_ARG(temp) \
2923template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T3, typename T4, typename T5> \
2924inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const temp<T1, T2, T3, T4, T5>& template_inst) { \
2925return writeIterator(template_inst.begin(), template_inst.end(), template_inst.size()); \
2926}
2927
2928#if defined(ELPP_STL_LOGGING)
2929 ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_TWO_ARG(std::vector)
2930 ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_TWO_ARG(std::list)
2931 ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_TWO_ARG(std::deque)
2932 ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_THREE_ARG(std::set)
2933 ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_THREE_ARG(std::multiset)
2934 ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_FOUR_ARG(std::map)
2935 ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_FOUR_ARG(std::multimap)
2936 template <class T, class Container>
2937 inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const std::queue<T, Container>& queue_) {
2938 base::workarounds::IterableQueue<T, Container> iterableQueue_ =
2939 static_cast<base::workarounds::IterableQueue<T, Container> >(queue_);
2940 return writeIterator(iterableQueue_.begin(), iterableQueue_.end(), iterableQueue_.size());
2941 }
2942 template <class T, class Container>
2943 inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const std::stack<T, Container>& stack_) {
2944 base::workarounds::IterableStack<T, Container> iterableStack_ =
2945 static_cast<base::workarounds::IterableStack<T, Container> >(stack_);
2946 return writeIterator(iterableStack_.begin(), iterableStack_.end(), iterableStack_.size());
2947 }
2948 template <class T, class Container, class Comparator>
2949 inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const std::priority_queue<T, Container, Comparator>& priorityQueue_) {
2950 base::workarounds::IterablePriorityQueue<T, Container, Comparator> iterablePriorityQueue_ =
2951 static_cast<base::workarounds::IterablePriorityQueue<T, Container, Comparator> >(priorityQueue_);
2952 return writeIterator(iterablePriorityQueue_.begin(), iterablePriorityQueue_.end(), iterablePriorityQueue_.size());
2953 }
2954 template <class First, class Second>
2955 MessageBuilder& operator<<(const std::pair<First, Second>& pair_) {
2956 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("(");
2957 operator << (static_cast<First>(pair_.first));
2958 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL(", ");
2959 operator << (static_cast<Second>(pair_.second));
2960 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL(")");
2961 return *this;
2962 }
2963 template <std::size_t Size>
2964 MessageBuilder& operator<<(const std::bitset<Size>& bitset_) {
2965 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("[");
2966 operator << (bitset_.to_string());
2967 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("]");
2968 return *this;
2969 }
2970# if defined(ELPP_LOG_STD_ARRAY)
2971 template <class T, std::size_t Size>
2972 inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const std::array<T, Size>& array) {
2973 return writeIterator(array.begin(), array.end(), array.size());
2974 }
2975# endif // defined(ELPP_LOG_STD_ARRAY)

3024 ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_ONE_ARG(QList)

3030 template <typename First, typename Second>
3031 MessageBuilder& operator<<(const QPair<First, Second>& pair_) {
3032 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("(");
3033 operator << (static_cast<First>(pair_.first));
3034 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL(", ");
3035 operator << (static_cast<Second>(pair_.second));
3036 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL(")");
3037 return *this;
3038 }
3039 template <typename K, typename V>
3040 MessageBuilder& operator<<(const QMap<K, V>& map_) {
3041 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("[");
3042 QList<K> keys = map_.keys();
3043 typename QList<K>::const_iterator begin = keys.begin();
3044 typename QList<K>::const_iterator end = keys.end();
3045 int max_ = static_cast<int>(base::consts::kMaxLogPerContainer); // to prevent warning
3046 for (int index_ = 0; begin != end && index_ < max_; ++index_, ++begin) {
3047 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("(");
3048 operator << (static_cast<K>(*begin));
3049 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL(", ");
3050 operator << (static_cast<V>(map_.value(*begin)));
3051 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL(")");
3052 m_logger->stream() << ((index_ < keys.size() -1) ? m_containerLogSeparator : ELPP_LITERAL(""));
3053 }
3054 if (begin != end) {
3055 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("...");
3056 }
3057 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("]");
3058 return *this;
3059 }
3060 template <typename K, typename V>
3061 inline MessageBuilder& operator<<(const QMultiMap<K, V>& map_) {
3062 operator << (static_cast<QMap<K, V>>(map_));
3063 return *this;
3064 }
3065 template <typename K, typename V>
3066 MessageBuilder& operator<<(const QHash<K, V>& hash_) {
3067 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("[");
3068 QList<K> keys = hash_.keys();
3069 typename QList<K>::const_iterator begin = keys.begin();
3070 typename QList<K>::const_iterator end = keys.end();
3071 int max_ = static_cast<int>(base::consts::kMaxLogPerContainer); // prevent type warning
3072 for (int index_ = 0; begin != end && index_ < max_; ++index_, ++begin) {
3073 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("(");
3074 operator << (static_cast<K>(*begin));
3075 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL(", ");
3076 operator << (static_cast<V>(hash_.value(*begin)));
3077 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL(")");
3078 m_logger->stream() << ((index_ < keys.size() -1) ? m_containerLogSeparator : ELPP_LITERAL(""));
3079 }
3080 if (begin != end) {
3081 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("...");
3082 }
3083 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("]");
3084 return *this;
3085 }

3111#define MAKE_CONTAINERELPP_FRIENDLY(ContainerType, SizeMethod, ElementInstance) \
3112el::base::type::ostream_t& operator<<(el::base::type::ostream_t& ss, const ContainerType& container) {\
3113const el::base::type::char_t* sep = ELPP->hasFlag(el::LoggingFlag::NewLineForContainer) ? \
3114ELPP_LITERAL("\n ") : ELPP_LITERAL(", ");\
3115ContainerType::const_iterator elem = container.begin();\
3116ContainerType::const_iterator endElem = container.end();\
3117std::size_t size_ = container.SizeMethod; \
3118ss << ELPP_LITERAL("[");\
3119for (std::size_t i = 0; elem != endElem && i < el::base::consts::kMaxLogPerContainer; ++i, ++elem) { \
3120ss << ElementInstance;\
3121ss << ((i < size_ - 1) ? sep : ELPP_LITERAL(""));\
3122}\
3123if (elem != endElem) {\
3124ss << ELPP_LITERAL("...");\
3125}\
3126ss << ELPP_LITERAL("]");\
3127return ss;\
3128}

3133# define ELPP_WX_HASH_MAP_ENABLED(ContainerType) MAKE_CONTAINERELPP_FRIENDLY(ContainerType, size(), \
3134ELPP_LITERAL("(") << elem->first << ELPP_LITERAL(", ") << elem->second << ELPP_LITERAL(")")
3135#else
3136# define ELPP_WX_PTR_ENABLED(ContainerType)
3137# define ELPP_WX_ENABLED(ContainerType)

3141 template <class Class>
3142 ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG(const Class&)
3143#undef ELPP_SIMPLE_LOG
3144#undef ELPP_ITERATOR_CONTAINER_LOG_ONE_ARG

3149 private:
3150 Logger* m_logger;
3151 const base::type::char_t* m_containerLogSeparator;
3152
3153 template<class Iterator>
3154 MessageBuilder& writeIterator(Iterator begin_, Iterator end_, std::size_t size_) {
3155 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("[");
3156 for (std::size_t i = 0; begin_ != end_ && i < base::consts::kMaxLogPerContainer; ++i, ++begin_) {
3157 operator << (*begin_);
3158 m_logger->stream() << ((i < size_ - 1) ? m_containerLogSeparator : ELPP_LITERAL(""));
3159 }
3160 if (begin_ != end_) {
3161 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("...");
3162 }
3163 m_logger->stream() << ELPP_LITERAL("]");
3164 if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::AutoSpacing)) {
3165 m_logger->stream() << " ";
3166 }
3167 return *this;
3168 }

3262// Logging from Logger class. Why this is here? Because we have Storage and Writer class available
3263#if ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED
3264template <typename T, typename... Args>
3265void Logger::log_(Level level, int vlevel, const char* s, const T& value, const Args&... args) {
3266 base::MessageBuilder b;
3267 b.initialize(this);
3268 while (*s) {
3269 if (*s == base::consts::kFormatSpecifierChar) {
3270 if (*(s + 1) == base::consts::kFormatSpecifierChar) {
3271 ++s;
3272 } else {
3273 if (*(s + 1) == base::consts::kFormatSpecifierCharValue) {
3274 ++s;
3275 b << value;
3276 log_(level, vlevel, ++s, args...);
3277 return;
3278 }
3279 }
3280 }
3281 b << *s++;
3282 }
3283 ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Too many arguments provided. Unable to handle. Please provide more format specifiers", false);
3284}
3285template <typename T>
3286void Logger::log_(Level level, int vlevel, const T& log) {
3287 if (level == Level::Verbose) {
3288 if (ELPP->vRegistry()->allowed(vlevel, __FILE__)) {
3289 base::Writer(Level::Verbose, "FILE", 0, "FUNCTION",
3290 base::DispatchAction::NormalLog, vlevel).construct(this, false) << log;
3291 } else {
3292 stream().str(ELPP_LITERAL(""));
3293 releaseLock();
3294 }
3295 } else {
3296 base::Writer(level, "FILE", 0, "FUNCTION").construct(this, false) << log;
3297 }
3298}
3299template <typename T, typename... Args>
3300inline void Logger::log(Level level, const char* s, const T& value, const Args&... args) {
3301 acquireLock(); // released in Writer!
3302 log_(level, 0, s, value, args...);
3303}
3304template <typename T>
3305inline void Logger::log(Level level, const T& log) {
3306 acquireLock(); // released in Writer!
3307 log_(level, 0, log);
3308}
3309# if ELPP_VERBOSE_LOG
3310template <typename T, typename... Args>
3311inline void Logger::verbose(int vlevel, const char* s, const T& value, const Args&... args) {
3312 acquireLock(); // released in Writer!
3313 log_(el::Level::Verbose, vlevel, s, value, args...);
3314}
3315template <typename T>
3316inline void Logger::verbose(int vlevel, const T& log) {
3317 acquireLock(); // released in Writer!
3318 log_(el::Level::Verbose, vlevel, log);
3319}
3320# else
3321template <typename T, typename... Args>
3322inline void Logger::verbose(int, const char*, const T&, const Args&...) {
3323 return;
3324}
3325template <typename T>
3326inline void Logger::verbose(int, const T&) {
3327 return;
3328}

3514 m_data = data;
3515 base::type::stringstream_t ss;
3516 if (m_data->dataType() == PerformanceTrackingData::DataType::Complete) {
3517 ss << ELPP_LITERAL("Executed [") << m_data->blockName()->c_str() << ELPP_LITERAL("] in [") <<
3518 *m_data->formattedTimeTaken() << ELPP_LITERAL("]");
3519 } else {
3520 ss << ELPP_LITERAL("Performance checkpoint");
3521 if (!m_data->checkpointId().empty()) {
3522 ss << ELPP_LITERAL(" [") << m_data->checkpointId().c_str() << ELPP_LITERAL("]");
3523 }
3524 ss << ELPP_LITERAL(" for block [") << m_data->blockName()->c_str() << ELPP_LITERAL("] : [") <<
3525 *m_data->performanceTracker();
3526 if (!ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::DisablePerformanceTrackingCheckpointComparison)
3527 && m_data->performanceTracker()->m_hasChecked) {
3528 ss << ELPP_LITERAL(" ([") << *m_data->formattedTimeTaken() << ELPP_LITERAL("] from ");
3529 if (m_data->performanceTracker()->m_lastCheckpointId.empty()) {
3530 ss << ELPP_LITERAL("last checkpoint");
3531 } else {
3532 ss << ELPP_LITERAL("checkpoint '") << m_data->performanceTracker()->m_lastCheckpointId.c_str() << ELPP_LITERAL("'");
3533 }
3534 ss << ELPP_LITERAL(")]");
3535 } else {
3536 ss << ELPP_LITERAL("]");
3537 }
3538 }
3539 el::base::Writer(m_data->performanceTracker()->level(), m_data->file(), m_data->line(), m_data->func()).construct(1,
3540 m_data->loggerId().c_str()) << ss.str();
3541 }
3542 private:
3543 const PerformanceTrackingData* m_data;
3544};
3545} // namespace base
3546inline const std::string* PerformanceTrackingData::blockName() const {
3547 return const_cast<const std::string*>(&m_performanceTracker->m_blockName);
3548}
3549inline const struct timeval* PerformanceTrackingData::startTime() const {
3550 return const_cast<const struct timeval*>(&m_performanceTracker->m_startTime);
3551}
3552inline const struct timeval* PerformanceTrackingData::endTime() const {
3553 return const_cast<const struct timeval*>(&m_performanceTracker->m_endTime);
3554}
3555inline const struct timeval* PerformanceTrackingData::lastCheckpointTime() const {
3556 return const_cast<const struct timeval*>(&m_performanceTracker->m_lastCheckpointTime);
3557}
3558inline const std::string& PerformanceTrackingData::loggerId(void) const {
3559 return m_performanceTracker->m_loggerId;
3560}

3736 template <typename T>
3737 static std::string convertTemplateToStdString(const T& templ) {
3738 el::Logger* logger =
3739 ELPP->registeredLoggers()->get(el::base::consts::kDefaultLoggerId);
3740 if (logger == nullptr) {
3741 return std::string();
3742 }
3743 base::MessageBuilder b;
3744 b.initialize(logger);
3745 logger->acquireLock();
3746 b << templ;
3747#if defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
3748 std::string s = std::string(logger->stream().str().begin(), logger->stream().str().end());
3749#else
3750 std::string s = logger->stream().str();
3751#endif // defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
3752 logger->stream().str(ELPP_LITERAL(""));
3753 logger->releaseLock();
3754 return s;
3755 }

4422// Check macros
4423#undef CCHECK

4425#undef CCHECK_EQ

4427#undef CCHECK_LT

4437#undef CHECK_EQ
4438#undef CHECK_NE
4439#undef CHECK_LT
4440#undef CHECK_GT
4441#undef CHECK_LE
4442#undef CHECK_GE
4443#undef CHECK_BOUNDS
4444#undef CHECK_NOTNULL
4445#undef CHECK_STRCASEEQ
4446#undef CHECK_STRCASENE
4447#define CCHECK(condition, ...) CLOG_IF(!(condition), FATAL, __VA_ARGS__) << "Check failed: [" << #condition << "] "
4448#define CPCHECK(condition, ...) CPLOG_IF(!(condition), FATAL, __VA_ARGS__) << "Check failed: [" << #condition << "] "
4449#define CHECK(condition) CCHECK(condition, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4450#define PCHECK(condition) CPCHECK(condition, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4451#define CCHECK_EQ(a, b, ...) CCHECK(a == b, __VA_ARGS__)
4452#define CCHECK_NE(a, b, ...) CCHECK(a != b, __VA_ARGS__)
4453#define CCHECK_LT(a, b, ...) CCHECK(a < b, __VA_ARGS__)
4454#define CCHECK_GT(a, b, ...) CCHECK(a > b, __VA_ARGS__)
4455#define CCHECK_LE(a, b, ...) CCHECK(a <= b, __VA_ARGS__)
4456#define CCHECK_GE(a, b, ...) CCHECK(a >= b, __VA_ARGS__)
4457#define CCHECK_BOUNDS(val, min, max, ...) CCHECK(val >= min && val <= max, __VA_ARGS__)
4458#define CHECK_EQ(a, b) CCHECK_EQ(a, b, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4459#define CHECK_NE(a, b) CCHECK_NE(a, b, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4460#define CHECK_LT(a, b) CCHECK_LT(a, b, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4461#define CHECK_GT(a, b) CCHECK_GT(a, b, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4462#define CHECK_LE(a, b) CCHECK_LE(a, b, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4463#define CHECK_GE(a, b) CCHECK_GE(a, b, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4464#define CHECK_BOUNDS(val, min, max) CCHECK_BOUNDS(val, min, max, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4465#define CCHECK_NOTNULL(ptr, ...) CCHECK((ptr) != nullptr, __VA_ARGS__)
4466#define CCHECK_STREQ(str1, str2, ...) CLOG_IF(!el::base::utils::Str::cStringEq(str1, str2), FATAL, __VA_ARGS__) \
4467<< "Check failed: [" << #str1 << " == " << #str2 << "] "
4468#define CCHECK_STRNE(str1, str2, ...) CLOG_IF(el::base::utils::Str::cStringEq(str1, str2), FATAL, __VA_ARGS__) \
4469<< "Check failed: [" << #str1 << " != " << #str2 << "] "
4470#define CCHECK_STRCASEEQ(str1, str2, ...) CLOG_IF(!el::base::utils::Str::cStringCaseEq(str1, str2), FATAL, __VA_ARGS__) \
4471<< "Check failed: [" << #str1 << " == " << #str2 << "] "
4472#define CCHECK_STRCASENE(str1, str2, ...) CLOG_IF(el::base::utils::Str::cStringCaseEq(str1, str2), FATAL, __VA_ARGS__) \
4473<< "Check failed: [" << #str1 << " != " << #str2 << "] "
4474#define CHECK_NOTNULL(ptr) CCHECK_NOTNULL((ptr), ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4475#define CHECK_STREQ(str1, str2) CCHECK_STREQ(str1, str2, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4476#define CHECK_STRNE(str1, str2) CCHECK_STRNE(str1, str2, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4477#define CHECK_STRCASEEQ(str1, str2) CCHECK_STRCASEEQ(str1, str2, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4478#define CHECK_STRCASENE(str1, str2) CCHECK_STRCASENE(str1, str2, ELPP_CURR_FILE_LOGGER_ID)
4479#undef DCCHECK
4480#undef DCCHECK_EQ
4481#undef DCCHECK_NE
4482#undef DCCHECK_LT
4483#undef DCCHECK_GT
4484#undef DCCHECK_LE
4485#undef DCCHECK_GE
